name: Italian Marinated Eggplant Antipasto
author: Rita
summary: Thin slices of eggplant are lightly fried, then marinated in a mixture of fresh herbs, garlic, olive oil, and white wine vinegar 8 hours or overnight. Well worth the wait! Delicious as part of an antipasti platter.
ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, divided, or more if needed
directions: Sprinkle eggplant slices with salt and layer on a plate
Set another plate on top as a weight and set aside for 30 minutes
Rinse eggplant and pat dry with paper towels
Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat and cook eggplant in batches until lightly browned, about 2 minutes per side, adding more olive oil as needed
Layer sauteed eggplant slices into a shallow dish
Sprinkle with parsley, basil, sage, garlic, salt, and pepper
Drizzle with remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil and white wine vinegar
Cover and marinate in the refrigerator 8 hours to overnight
